title: Update marketing site UI/UX to match Vercel.com visual style

requirements.text: Update the UI/UX reference target from https://seosherpa.com/ to https://vercel.com/ and restyle the existing AMS Digital Agency single-page marketing site to closely match Vercel’s visual style and interaction patterns (layout density, typography, color system, borders, shadows, hover/focus states, and overall polish) while keeping all existing section structure and AMS Digital Agency branding/content.
acceptanceCriteria: The site’s overall look and feel is recognizably Vercel-inspired: neutral/monochrome palette, crisp borders/dividers, subtle elevation, and restrained accent usage (no bright gradient-forward brand styling as the primary motif).
No new product features or new pages are introduced; only styling/UX is changed across existing sections (Header, Hero, Services, Proof, Testimonials, Process, About, CTA, Legal, Footer).
All existing navigation/footer anchor links (#services, #process, #testimonials, #about, #contact, #privacy, #terms, #cookies) continue to work and scroll smoothly.
All user-facing text remains professional English and retains AMS Digital Agency meaning (do not replace with Vercel product copy).

requirements.text: Implement Vercel-like component-level styling updates across the marketing UI by adjusting the design tokens and section/component compositions (e.g., global theme variables, container/spacing utilities, and section shells) to achieve a clean, high-contrast, grid-and-divider-forward aesthetic that works in both light and dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme variables and base styles (e.g., in frontend/src/index.css) are updated to a Vercel-like neutral palette with clear semantic contrast for text, borders, and surfaces.
Header, buttons, badges, cards, and section wrappers exhibit consistent Vercel-like styling: minimal rounding, subtle shadows (or none), thin borders, and refined hover/focus states.

The Hero section’s visual treatment is updated away from colorful gradients toward a Vercel-like restrained treatment (e.g., subtle grid/background texture and clean panels) while keeping existing content and CTAs.
No edits are made to any immutable UI component source files under frontend/src/components/ui or other listed immutablePaths; changes are achieved via composition and styling in editable files.

constraints: Do not edit any files under the frontend immutable paths (including frontend/src/components/ui and the Internet Identity/actor hooks listed as immutable).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this UI refresh.
Do not introduce unrelated product features; this request is a visual/UX restyle to match https://vercel.com/.
nonGoals: Adding a blog, CMS, or new site sections not already present in App.tsx.
Adding authentication changes, backend methods, or persistence (backend/main.mo can remain empty).
